image.altText: Douglas Boyd conducting the Adelaide Symphony Orchestra in concert at the Adelaide Town Hall.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's culture of music has garnered global recognition, but some arts leaders say there's a missing piece of the puzzle.

title.children: 'A sore point': Adelaide's long wait for a purpose-built concert hall

image.altText: A woman wearing a red blazer is talking with shadows in front of her

props.synopsis: Until the last election, the electorate of Boothby hadn't been in the hands of a Labor candidate since 1949 — but the ALP's Louise Miller-Frost broke that streak by winning the seat, and is now taking another tilt.

title.children: Labor won Boothby for the first time in 73 years — can it hold it?

image.altText: An aerial shot of sandy desert meeting an inland lake with blue skies.

props.synopsis: The deluge which battered south-west Queensland is now draining downhill to a catchment area five times the size of the UK.

title.children: Floodwaters to create Australia's largest lake in 15 years

image.altText: Reuben Ginbey and Zac Williams roll upside down as they are tangled in a tackle

props.synopsis: As Brisbane and the Western Bulldogs played one of the games of the year in Norwood, Adelaide Oval was treated to a double header of gloriously bad football. This was Gather Round's first ever Sicko Saturday.

title.children: Gather Round's Sicko Saturday treats Adelaide Oval to some gloriously bad football

image.altText: A man with a shadowed face and blonde hair leaves court

props.synopsis: Former South Australian Liberal Party leader David Speirs started using cocaine in June 2024 when it was offered to him by a "third party" to cope with stress, a court has heard.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader used cocaine as 'escapism', court hears

image.altText: House fire crime scene at Woodville Gardens, SA

props.synopsis: South Australian police have arrested two men and charged them with the murder of a Woodville Gardens man who was found dead after a house fire in November 2024.

title.children: Murder and arson charges laid after Adelaide house fire

image.altText: Pacific oyster

props.synopsis: A review into the deaths of 70 per cent of South Australia's oyster spat has not unearthed any clues.

title.children: Cause of oyster spat deaths at research facility remains a mystery

image.altText: A build-up of foam at Petrel Cove.

props.synopsis: Investigations are ongoing to determine whether the presence of more dead marine life on SA's shores is related to the recent algal bloom on the Fleurieu Peninsula. WARNING: This story contains content that readers may find distressing.

title.children: As dead sea life wash up on SA's coast, concerns rise over algal bloom spread

image.altText: People walking on a footpath with arches of a 19th century stone building

props.synopsis: Four Adelaide city councillors have lost their positions, and voters will need to re-cast ballots, after a judge found results in one of the wards during the November 2022 elections were affected by "illegal practices".

title.children: Adelaide council ward election result declared void after 'illegal practices'

image.altText: A skinny, dark-coated dog wearing a brightly coloured collar.

props.synopsis: A Mount Gambier woman has received a suspended prison sentence after admitting to the ill treatment of six dogs in her care.

title.children: Woman avoids jail after dogs found starving in SA home

image.altText: People sit around a bar lit up with light underground

props.synopsis: South Australia has released its latest tourism campaign to capitalise on the AFL's Gather Round focusing on the Barossa, but Adelaide will feature too in "episodes" to come.

title.children: South Australia picks 'simple pleasures' as brand to reel in tourists

image.altText: Boxes of vapes stacked next to each other on display

props.synopsis: More than 30 premises were targeted in raids across the Eyre Peninsula and the Mid-North region.

title.children: SA police seize $1.5m of tobacco in raids against 'criminal syndicates'

image.altText: A bald man.

props.synopsis: The leader of a far-right neo-Nazi group has failed in his efforts to get the court to remove a 'radical' bail condition barring him from communicating with other members of the group.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader tells court bail is 'impinging' his 'fundamental rights'

image.altText: A drone shot of a forestry pine plantation.

props.synopsis: Severe and prolonged drought conditions in one of Australia's largest forestry regions are killing pine trees, and raising concerns about the future of the country's building material supplies.

title.children: Fears for major forestry region as pines trees die from drought stress

image.altText: Outback flooding in South Australia's far north.

props.synopsis: While communities around Adelaide cope with drought, another part of South Australia is dealing with a "historic" flood event. Here's what we know.

title.children: Flooding has created an 'inland tsunami' in remote South Australia

image.altText: A man holds a blue can with an American flag on it

props.synopsis: On-again-off-again tariffs and an intensifying trade war with China are taking their toll on ordinary Americans in a range of ways.

title.children: 'Freezing us': American businesses paralysed in evolving trade war

image.altText: Composite image of three people, a woman smiling, a man with blond hair and a woman talking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Politicians are on a mission this election to connect with voters online like never before. It is opening the door for podcasters and social media personalities to have increasing political influence.

title.children: 'Delulu with no solulu': Influencers changing how politicians campaign

image.altText: Charles and Camilla grin and embrace

props.synopsis: It's been 20 years since Charles was finally able to marry the love of his life, but his wedding to Camilla featured a bout of sinusitis, an unhappy son, and a requirement that they both apologise to God for their behaviour.

title.children: 'Taken to the town square and humiliated': Charles and Camilla's awkward wedding

image.altText: happy snowboarders

props.synopsis: International tourists, especially Australians, started to arrive en masse in the famous Japanese ski resort of Niseko in the early 2000s. Now the influx has pushed the cost of housing so high it's almost impossible for locals to compete with wealthy foreigners for property.

title.children: Foreign ski bums turned this Japanese mountain into a real estate nightmare

image.altText: A pair of hands are seen demonstrating how to brush dentures with a toothbrush.

props.synopsis: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

title.children: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election

image.altText: Raneem Abu Izneid looks at the camera seriously.

props.synopsis: Australian citizen Ranem Abu-Izneid lost sight in one eye after being struck by shrapnel while studying in her university accommodation in the West Bank. She says five months on from the incident, she's no closer to getting any accountability.

title.children: Injured Australian student still seeking answers after alleged West Bank shooting

image.altText: Parker Posey, wearing a printed kaftan and stylish sunglasses, at a leafy Thai resort on the set of The White Lotus

props.synopsis: Our fascination with the rich and famous often seems to curdle into something darker, even if it is hard to tell if we're eating the rich or eating cake.

title.children: Is our obsession with The White Lotus a sign we've had enough of the 1 per cent?

image.altText: Jason Day walking off the green at the US Masters tournament

props.synopsis: Australian Jason Day will enter the final round of the US Masters with an outside chance of victory. Check out the live leaderboard as the third round at Augusta National progresses.

title.children: Day in Masters contention after birdie chip-in, McIlroy storms to lead

image.altText: Oscar Piastri hugging a team member in pit lane after qualifying pole in Bahrain

props.synopsis: Australian Oscar Piastri will start an F1 grand prix from pole for the second time in his career, qualifying fastest in Bahrain for Monday's (AEST) race.

title.children: Piastri produces blistering lap to secure pole for F1 Bahrain Grand Prix

image.altText: Tasmanian tiger in captivity.

props.synopsis: There was a lot of hype about an American company's announcement about ancient dire wolves. It raises questions about the bid to "bring back" the Tasmanian tiger.

title.children: What does the dire wolf 'de-extinction' mean for bringing back Tasmanian tigers?

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson smirks behind the podium. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: Today might be the day you finally do OK at this quiz, but I'm not holding my breath.

title.children: You think you're good at quizzes? Let's test that theory

image.altText: Torrie Lewis, Bree Rizzo and Leah O'Brien hit the line together the women's 100m final at the national championships.

props.synopsis: The barest of margins separate Paris Olympian Torrie Lewis and boom 17-year-old Leah O'Brien in the women's 100 metres final at the Australian Athletics Championships.

title.children: Lewis wins national 100m final by 0.004 of a second in dramatic photo finish

image.altText: Man with helmet climbs on scaffolding

props.synopsis: The state building commission has failed to secure a memorandum of understanding with NSW Police since 2023 to run criminal history checks on tradies before granting licences.

title.children: NSW tradies granted licences without a criminal history check

image.altText: Alex De Minaur of Australia returns a shot during the semifinal match

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's outstanding week in Monte-Carlo comes to an end with his defeat to Lorenzo Musetti.

title.children: De Minaur's Monte-Carlo run ends with semifinal loss

image.altText: Rohan Browning celebrates winning 100m final at national championships.

props.synopsis: Rohan Browning caused an upset by pipping rising star Lachlan Kennedy at the Australian Athletics Championships, while Torrie Lewis edged out 17-year-old Leah O'Brien.

title.children: Browning pips favourite Kennedy in 100m thriller to win national title

image.altText: A photo of Bella Thorne. She has long brown hair,  brown eyes, red eyeshadow.

props.synopsis: Bella Thorne has accused fellow actor Mickey Rourke of on-set misconduct after singer JoJo Siwa's "homophobic" slur claims.

title.children: Thorne accuses Rourke of bruising her genitals with a metal grinder on set

image.altText: A woman in pink looks at the camera. A boy sits to her left and a man to her right.

props.synopsis: Coastal fishing hamlet Dongara has honoured its multicultural heritage, unveiling "Sikh Lane", the first "Sikh" place name in the state.

title.children: WA town puts its Sikh history on the map with a laneway party

image.altText: Close up photo of Saman Shad in floral jacket with red slipstick and brown hair to the side, smiling slightly with closed mouth.

props.synopsis: When Saman Shad sat down to write her latest novel, she came up against several challenges. Not least of them was how to find time to write amid the chaos of having a small family.

title.children: Why novel The Sex Lives of Married Women made its author nervous

image.altText: A close up of Opposition Leader Peter Dutton touching his glasses.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has resorted to relentless social media posts about the prime minister falling off a stage and lying about it.

title.children: The PM's fall won't distract from the Coalition's lack of policy detail

image.altText: a man in ablue jacket speaking to media behind a microphone

props.synopsis: Queensland's health minister says Monash IVF is being monitored after the wrong embryo was transferred to a patient at a Brisbane clinic.

title.children: Health officials watching Monash IVF after embryo transfer bungle
